Detailed Description

A template is an object that refers to child objects, templates also. It uses a skeleton to place subTemplates. By recurrent generation of content, it lets us create many documents like WebPages.

This class implements basic methods and constants for Template-s.

Template::AddToTag (  $  tagName,
$  value
) 
 

Adds $value to the Template's skeleton associated to the tag named $tagName The skeleton you've set may contain the tag named $tag.

Parameters:
$tagName the name of the tag to be gotten for update
$value the string to be added to skeleton of Template associated to tag named $tagName
Returns:
NULL if operation was successful

TemplateError::TEMPLATE_TAG_INEXISTANT if tag named $tagName doesn't exist.

builds a Tag from TAG_OPEN, $tagName and TAG_CLOSE

Returns:

Template::Generate (  $  cached = false  ) 
 

Generates a printable version of object for final print out. It replaces each tag by it's Template Generated value. So it generate final document by hierarchy.

Parameters:
$cached boolean that should always be false. It enables caching of generated values for future call. Due to internal generation by hierarchy, the function always call herself with $cached as true
Returns:
printable version of document

Template::GetTag (  $  tagName  ) 
 

Gets sub-Template assigned to tag named $tagName. The skeleton you've set may contain the tag named $tag.

Parameters:
$tagName the name of the tag to be gotten
Returns:
The Template object assigned to the tag named $tagName if it exists.
